Name: Master of Science in Crop Science
Description: Advanced study in crop science, focusing on research and development in crop production.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: A candidate must normally be a holder of at least a good first degree in Agronomy, Crop Science or Horticulture or related fields from a recognised University.

Name: Master of Science in Crop Protection
Description: Advanced study in protecting crops from various threats, including pests and diseases.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: A candidate must normally be a holder of at least a good first degree in Agronomy, Crop Science or Horticulture or related fields from a recognised University.

Name: Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Agricultural Economics and Development
Description: Examines economic principles applied to agriculture and rural development.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: At least two A-Level passes in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Business Studies and anyone from the following relevant subjects such as Accounting, Geography, Sociology, Agriculture or Biology.

Name: Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Agricultural Economics and Development
Description: Examines economic principles applied to agriculture and rural development, with a focus on visiting school mode.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: 5 'O' Levels including English Language and Mathematics and a Diploma in Agriculture from any college recognised by MSU.

Name: Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Information Technology for Agricultural Systems
Description: Integrates information technology solutions within agricultural practices and systems.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: At least two A-Level passes in Mathematics / Statistics / Computer Science and any one from the following relevant subjects such as Economics, Business Studies, Accounting, Geography, Agriculture or Biology.

Name: Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Applied Agricultural Sciences and Business
Description: Combines agricultural sciences with business principles for practical applications in the agricultural sector.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: At least two A-Level passes in relevant subjects such as Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Business Studies, Accounting, Geography, Sociology, Agriculture or Biology.

Name: Bachelor of Science (Honours) in Agricultural Value Chain and Marketing
Description: Focuses on the entire value chain of agricultural products, from production to market.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: At least two A-Level passes in relevant subjects such as Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Business Studies, Accounting, Geography, Sociology, Agriculture or Biology.

Name: Master of Science in Applied Agricultural Economics
Description: Advanced study in applying economic theories to agricultural issues and policies.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: A candidate must normally be a holder of at least a lower second class (2.2) first degree in Agriculture, Agricultural Economics; Economics; or any other related programme from a recognized University.

Name: Master of Science in Agricultural Informatics and Data Analytics
Description: Focuses on the use of data science and informatics in agricultural decision-making and innovation.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Candidates should typically hold at least a lower second class (2.2) undergraduate degree in Agricultural Informatics, Agricultural Economics, Agricultural Sciences, Bioinformatics, Information Technology, Data Science, Statistics, Biostatistics, Geographical information systems or a related field from a recognized university.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours Degree in Animal and Wildlife Sciences
Description: Studies the biology, management, and conservation of domestic and wild animals.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five 'O' levels subjects including English and Mathematics with a grade C or better, Any 2 'A' level subjects with at least one science subject from the following, Biology, Chemistry, Agriculture, Geography, physics/Relevant Diploma in Agriculture.

Name: Masters in Animal Breeding and Biotechnology
Description: Advanced study in genetic improvement of animals and biotechnological applications in animal science.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Honours degree (class 2.2/GPA 2.0 or better) in Agriculture or the biological sciences in the following disciplines, Animal Science, Animal Health and Production, Biological Sciences, Biotechnology and Natural Resources, Veterinary Science or related fields from an accredited University. Candidates with a third class or where the degree was not classified, will be required to attend an interview to assess their competence.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Dairy Sciences
Description: Specializes in the science and technology of dairy production and processing.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five 'O 'level subjects including English and any 2 'A 'Level subjects with at least one science subject from the following, Biology, Chemistry, Agriculture, Geography, Physics/Relevant Diploma in Agriculture.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Poultry Sciences
Description: Focuses on the scientific principles and practices of poultry farming and production.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five 'O 'level subjects including English and any 2 'A 'Level subjects with at least one science subject from the following, Biology, Chemistry, Agriculture, Geography, Physics/Relevant Diploma in Agriculture.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Wildlife Ecology and Management
Description: Studies the ecological principles and management strategies for wildlife populations and their habitats.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five 'O 'level subjects including English and any 2 'A 'Level subjects with at least one science subject from the following, Biology, Chemistry, Agriculture, Geography, Physics/Relevant Diploma in Agriculture.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Land and Water Resources Management
Description: Focuses on the sustainable management of land and water resources.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five "O" levels including English language, Science and Mathematics and at least two "A" level passes that may include Geography or any Sciences subject. A good pass in any relevant diploma may be considered for prospective students without "A" level passes.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Environmental Science and Technology
Description: Examines environmental issues and technological solutions for sustainability.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five "O" levels including English language, Science and Mathematics and at least two "A" level passes that may include Geography or any Sciences subject. A good pass in any relevant diploma may be considered for prospective students without "A" level passes.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Water and Sanitation
Description: Focuses on the provision of safe water and sanitation systems.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five "O" levels including English language, Science and Mathematics and at least two "A" level passes that may include Geography or any Sciences subject. A good pass in any relevant diploma may be considered for prospective students without "A" level passes.

Name: Bachelor of Science Honours in Biosystems Engineering
Description: Applies engineering principles to biological systems, particularly in agriculture and environment.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: Five "O" levels including English language, Science and Mathematics and at least two "A" level passes that may include Mathematics or any Sciences subject.

Name: Master of Science in Land and Water Resources Management
Description: Advanced study in the integrated management of land and water resources for sustainable development.
Faculty: Faculty of Agriculture, Environment and Natural Resources
Requirements: A candidate must normally be a holder of at least a lower second class (2.2) pass in BSc (Hons) Land and Water Resources Management Honours Degree, BSc (Hons) Geography and Environmental Science Honours Degree or any relevant BSc (Hons) degree or any other related programme from a recognized University.
